content.raw:
[AtlasPlugin.cc](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/fb860e62722c449868fa395e3eece367b3ac0b4a/drcsim_gazebo_ros_plugins/src/AtlasPlugin.cpp?at=default) as well as several of the pub_...cc files have lists of joints or links. While some of them only use this list as a count, others use them to create topics or params.

 * [pub_joint_commands.cpp](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/fb860e62722c449868fa395e3eece367b3ac0b4a/drcsim_gazebo_ros_plugins/src/pub_joint_commands.cpp?at=default)

 * [pub_joint_states.cpp](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/fb860e62722c449868fa395e3eece367b3ac0b4a/drcsim_gazebo_ros_plugins/src/pub_joint_states.cpp?at=default)

 * [pub_atlas_state.cpp](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/fb860e62722c449868fa395e3eece367b3ac0b4a/drcsim_gazebo_ros_plugins/src/pub_atlas_state.cpp?at=default)


(*are these actually used or are they effectively dead code?*)

AtlasPlugin.cc has been updated to handle the [v3 changes](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/c0ed0733edd3/drcsim_gazebo_ros_plugins/src/AtlasPlugin.cpp) but this potentially would put the others out of sync if the v3 model is loaded.

It seems as though it would make sense for all of that source code to be sharing the same list by parameterization, perhaps by pulling from a  ROS parameter list.

I may end up doing such a parameterization anyway so I may be able to offer a patch/pull request to that effect.
content.html:
AtlasPlugin.cc as well as several of the pub_...cc files have lists of joints or links. While some of them only use this list as a count, others use them to create topics or params.

  • pub_joint_commands.cpp

  • pub_joint_states.cpp

  • pub_atlas_state.cpp

(are these actually used or are they effectively dead code?)

AtlasPlugin.cc has been updated to handle the v3 changes but this potentially would put the others out of sync if the v3 model is loaded.

It seems as though it would make sense for all of that source code to be sharing the same list by parameterization, perhaps by pulling from a ROS parameter list.

I may end up doing such a parameterization anyway so I may be able to offer a patch/pull request to that effect.
